column4: Activision says U.S. court stops $8.2 billion deal with Vivendi
column5: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. court has handed down a preliminary decision to halt the closing of Vivendi SA's $8.2 billion deal to sell most of its stake in Activision Blizzard Inc back to the U.S. company  the games publisher said on Wednesday.

column5: Sept 18 Atossa Genetics Inc said an affiliate of U.S. drug wholesaler McKesson Corp would distribute its device used to collect breast fluid for cancer detection.

column5: CHICAGO The clearinghouse for all U.S. stock options on Wednesday named Craig Donohue  former chief executive officer for CME Group Inc  as its new executive chairman.

column4: UPDATE 1-CME applies to get into new swaps exchange business
column5: Sept 18 CME Group Inc  the biggest U.S. futures market operator  has applied with the Commodity Futures Trading Commission to register as a swap execution facility (SEF)  an exchange-like platform created as a result of the global crackdown on the derivatives that helped bring the 2007-2008 credit crisis.

column4: U.S. court denies ABC request to halt sales of Dish's 'Hopper'
column5: A Manhattan federal judge on Wednesday denied a request by Walt Disney Co's ABC unit to stop Dish Network Corp from selling devices that let viewers skip commercials when watching primetime broadcast shows.

column4: Facebook's Zuckerberg says U.S. spying hurt users' trust
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 18 Facebook Inc CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday said revelations about U.S. government surveillance hurt users' trust in Internet companies and that knowing more about the programs would help relieve some of the public concerns.

column4: Facebook 'like' deserves free speech protection: U.S. court
column5: Facebook users who employ the website's "like" feature to show support for a political candidate engage in legally protected speech  a U.S. appeals court said  reviving a lawsuit examining the limits of what people may constitutionally do online.

column4: Fitch: U.S. Bank Liquidity  Credit Ample As Fed Delays Taper
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  September 18 (Fitch) Today's announcement by the Federal Reserve that  it will make no changes in its asset purchase program suggests that U.S. bank  liquidity will remain near record levels  as securities held on the Fed's  balance sheet continue to grow. When a tapering of QE does eventually begin   Fitch expects the impact of reduced bond buying to have little immediate effect  on banks' lending capacity and funding costs. F

column4: Microsoft to unveil more TV projects for Xbox One entertainment hub
column5: TOKYO Microsoft Corp will follow its Steven Spielberg collaboration with more television projects aimed at positioning its new Xbox games console as a home entertainment hub.

column4: Microsoft to unveil more TV projects for Xbox One entertainment hub
column5: TOKYO  Sept 18 Microsoft Corp will follow its Steven Spielberg collaboration with more television projects aimed at positioning its new Xbox games console as a home entertainment hub.

column4: RLPC-Sears sets price talk on $1 bln refi credit
column5: Sept 18 Retailer Sears Holdings Corp  set price guidance on its new $1 billion term loan earmarked to pay down revolver borrowings at the company  sources told Thompson Reuters LPC.

column4: COLUMN-Starbucks policy shift is small win for gun safety  big one for economic boycotts
column5: Sept 18 Starbucks' decision this week to ask customers to leave their guns at the door will please many of its loyal customers. Gun safety advocates are also claiming the move as a major victory and are promising to move on to other retailers that allow guns in their outlets. Nobody  however  should be as charged up as Elliot Fineman.

column4: Starbucks policy shift is small win for gun safety  big one for economic boycotts
column5: Starbucks' decision this week to ask customers to leave their guns at the door will please many of its loyal customers. Gun safety advocates are also claiming the move as a major victory and are promising to move on to other retailers that allow guns in their outlets. Nobody  however  should be as charged up as Elliot Fineman.

column4: UPDATE 2-Starbucks asks U.S. customers to leave guns at home
column5: Sept 18 Coffee chain Starbucks Corp has asked U.S. customers to  leave their guns at home after being dragged into an increasingly fractious debate over U.S. gun rights in the wake of multiple mass shootings.

column4: Starbucks asks U.S. customers to leave guns at home

column4: Starbucks changes course  asks U.S. patrons to leave guns at home
column5: Sept 17 Starbucks Corp Chief Executive Howard Schultz requested on Tuesday that the coffee chain's customers leave their firearms at home  shifting company policy amid an increasingly fractious debate over U.S. gun rights in the wake of multiple mass shootings.

column4: Take Two's GTA V starts strong with $800 mln in first-day sales
column5: SAN FRANCISCO "Grand Theft Auto V " the fifth installment of the video game that became a focal point of debate about gratuitous violence and explicit content in the media  came out guns blasting with $800 million in global first-day sales.

column4: Market Chatter- Corporate finance press digest
column5: Sept 18 The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media on Wednesday:

column4: Santander hiring of ex-Bankia boss Rato dismays hard-pressed Spaniards
column5: MADRID  Sept 18 Santander's hiring of Rodrigo Rato  former chairman of rescued lender Bankia   was met with dismay on Wednesday by those Spaniards doubtful that any top financier will be held to account for the country's banking crisis.

column4: Analysis: Time to taper? Not if you look at bank loans
column5: The U.S. Federal Reserve decided to hold off on scaling back its bond-buying program on Wednesday  and at least one reason for its choice may have been a stubbornly weak economic indicator: bank lending.

column4: Bank of America names Bettamio as Latin America head  source says
column5: SAO PAULO  Sept 17 Bank of America Corp  named Alexandre Bettamio  the chief executive officer of its investment-banking unit in Brazil  as head of its Latin America unit  a source with knowledge of the situation said late on Tuesday.

column4: Boeing  Air Lease finalize $9.4 billion order for Dreamliner jets
column5: Air Lease Corp  on Wednesday finalized an order for 33 stretched Dreamliner jets from Boeing Co  for about $9.4 billion at list prices.

column4: UPDATE 1-Affordability is R&D focus for arms industry -executives
column5: NATIONAL HARBOR  Md.  Sept 18 The single biggest driver for research and development in the U.S. arms industry is not a hot area like unmanned weapons  cyberspace  or surveillance  but the need to make systems affordable  executives and defense officials say.

column4: Boeing  Air Lease finalize $9.4 bln order for Dreamliner jets
column5: Sept 18 Air Lease Corp on Wednesday finalized an order for 33 stretched Dreamliner jets from Boeing Co for about $9.4 billion at list prices.

column4: Lufthansa may order up to 34 revamped Boeing 777s -sources
column5: Sept 18 Deutsche Lufthansa looks poised to place an order for up to 34 revamped Boeing 777-9X passenger planes as part of a fleet overhaul to be unveiled on Thursday  two people familiar with the matter said.

column4: Boeing to close assembly line for C-17 transport jet
column5: SEATTLE Boeing Co  said on Wednesday that it would stop making its distinctive-looking C-17 military transport plane in 2015 because of faltering sales  and would lay off up to 3 000 employees involved in the 30-year-old program.

column4: UPDATE 1-Boeing to close assembly line for C-17 transport jet
column5: SEATTLE  Sept 18 Boeing Co said on Wednesday that it would stop making its distinctive-looking C-17 military transport plane in 2015 because of faltering sales  and would lay off up to 3 000 employees involved in the 30-year-old program.

column4: UPDATE 2-Lufthansa signals major wide-body jet order
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 18 Deutsche Lufthansa  signalled its second major aircraft order in six months on Wednesday  saying its supervisory board had backed a long-haul fleet plan that industry watchers expect to benefit Airbus  and Boeing.

column4: Italy's Eni aims for top five spot in energy trading league
column5: LONDON  Sept 18 The trading desk of Italian energy firm Eni is fast emerging from the shadows of established peers as it begins to rival oil majors BP and Shell in some of their favourite markets.

column4: Brookfield Asset looks to Europe for bargains
column5: TORONTO  Sept 18 Brookfield Asset Management  is seeking assets in Europe to take advantage of an expected wave of sales  and also sees opportunities in Latin America and in the hard-hit commodity sector  the company's chief financial officer said on Wednesday.

column4: Vale to sell control of VLI unit to Mitsui  Brookfield
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO/SAO PAULO Brazilian mining company Vale SA said on Wednesday it plans to sell control of its VLI SA general rail- and port-cargo unit to Canadian  Japanese and Brazilian investors in a transaction expected to be worth about 4 billion reais ($1.79 billion).

column4: UPDATE 2-Vale to sell control of VLI unit to Mitsui  Brookfield
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO/SAO PAULO  Sept 18 Brazilian mining company Vale SA said on Wednesday it plans to sell control of its VLI SA general rail- and port-cargo unit to Canadian  Japanese and Brazilian investors in a transaction expected to be worth about 4 billion reais ($1.79 billion).

column4: Tribunal finds Ecuador released Chevron from pollution liability
column5: In a dispute stemming from a lengthy legal battle over Amazon rain forest pollution  arbitrators ruled that Chevron had already settled claims for damages in agreements with Ecuador despite a $19 billion award against the oil company.

column4: Alibaba to pre-install apps on China Telecom phones - source
column5: BEIJING  Sept 18 Alibaba Group  whose plans to go public could value the company at over $100 billion  may soon have their apps pre-installed on China Telecom's  mobile phones  said a source familiar with negotiations between the two firms.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-Fed surprise propels TSX to two-year high
column5: TORONTO  Sept 18 Canada's main stock index climbed to its highest point in more than two years on Wednesday  led up by a jump in gold producers after the U.S. Federal Reserve said it would keep its monetary stimulus measures in place for now.

column4: ON THE MOVE-Deutsche Bank hires broker team from Merrill Lynch
column5: Sept 18 Deutsche Bank AG's   asset and wealth management division said on Wednesday it has hired a team of veteran advisers from Bank of America Corp's  Merrill Lynch to expand the firm's presence in Texas.

column4: UPDATE 1-Deutsche Bank asset shedding going well -CFO
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 18 Deutsche Bank is making headway in its efforts to cut 250 billion euros ($334 billion) in assets as it adjusts to stricter bank rules  Chief Financial Officer Stefan Krause said on Wednesday.

column4: Deutsche Bank asset shedding going well -CFO
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 18 Deutsche Bank is making headway in its goal to shed 250 billion euros ($334 billion) in assets as it adjusts to stricter bank rules  Chief Financial Officer Stefan Krause said on Wednesday.

column4: Encana returns more Colorado wells to service after floods
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 18 Canadian energy producer Encana Corp said on Wednesday that 150 wells shut due to flooding in Colorado had been returned to service  but 245 remained shut in.

column4: Analysis: Bribery scandal dents Big Pharma sales in China  GSK hardest hit
column5: SHANGHAI/LONDON A crackdown on corruption in China's pharmaceutical sector has hurt sales at international and local firms  with many doctors at Chinese hospitals refusing to see drug representatives for fear of being caught up in the widening scandal.

column4: Halliburton sees earnings hurt by Colorado floods: UBS
column5: U.S. oilfield services company Halliburton Co  expects recent flooding in Colorado to hurt third-quarter earnings by as much as 3 cents per share  according to a research note from UBS.

column4: Halliburton sees earnings hurt by Colorado floods-UBS
column5: Sept 18 U.S. oilfield services company Halliburton Co expects recent flooding in Colorado to hurt third-quarter earnings by as much as 3 cents per share  according to a research note from UBS.

column4: Power veteran Posoli returns to JPMorgan to advise on commodities sale
column5: NEW YORK Power market veteran Paul Posoli has returned to JPMorgan Chase & Co.  after a year-long sabbatical to help advise on the bank's sale of its physical commodities business  according to an internal bank memo.

column5: NEW YORK  Sept 18 Power market veteran Paul Posoli has returned to JPMorgan Chase & Co. after a year-long sabbatical to help advise on the bank's sale of its physical commodities business  according to an internal bank memo.

column4: Power veteran Posoli returns to JPMorgan to manage commods sale -memo
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 18 Power market veteran Paul Posoli has returned to JPMorgan Chase & Co. after a sabbatical to help advise on the bank's planned sale of its commodities business  according to an internal bank memo.

column4: RPT-Market Chatter- Corporate finance press digest
column5: Sept 18 The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media on Wednesday:

column4: Market Chatter- Corporate finance press digest

column4: Kinder Morgan chairman denies skimping on maintenance
column5: Kinder Morgan's billionaire chairman on Wednesday denied the U.S. pipeline company skimps on maintenance spending  hitting back at allegations by a young analyst that have rattled the company's shares.

column4: Lazard to advise administrators on sale of Italy's Pop Spoleto
column5: MILAN  Sept 18 Special administrators appointed by the Bank of Italy to run Banca Popolare di Spoleto  a small cooperative lender  have chosen investment bank Lazard to advise on investors interested in buying the Italian bank.

column4: Atossa signs breast device deal with McKesson  shares surge
column5: Sept 18 Atossa Genetics Inc said an affiliate of U.S. drug wholesaler McKesson Corp would distribute its device used to collect breast fluid for cancer detection.

column4: UBS poaches Morgan Stanley's global head of research
column5: LONDON  Sept 18 Swiss bank UBS said on Wednesday it has appointed Morgan Stanley's Juan Luis Perez as its global head of research.

column4: FTSE led lower by Aberdeen  stays in tight pre-Fed range
column5: * Smiths Group buoyed by special dividend   (Adds closing prices)

column4: CEO Blankfein says commodities trading is 'core' to Goldman
column5: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  Chief Executive Lloyd Blankfein made his most public commitment to the bank's commodity trading business on Wednesday  even as regulators consider measures that may push Wall Street out of physical markets.

column4: Lured by Texas talent  Occidental strays from California roots
column5: Occidental Petroleum Corp  may still be headquartered in Los Angeles  as it has been since being founded nearly a century ago  but its center of gravity is shifting to Houston  capital of the U.S. energy industry.

column4: FEATURE-Lured by Texas talent  Occidental strays from California roots
column5: Sept 18 Occidental Petroleum Corp may still be headquartered in Los Angeles  as it has been since being founded nearly a century ago  but its center of gravity is shifting to Houston  capital of the U.S. energy industry.

column4: Oracle gives cautious outlook for second quarter
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Oracle Corp  forecast sales and profit for its second quarter that fell short of expectations as it continues to battle soft global IT demand and smaller rivals focused on providing software over the Internet.

column4: UPDATE 3-Oracle gives cautious outlook for second quarter
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Sept 18 Oracle Corp  forecast sales and profit for its second quarter that fell short of expectations as it continues to battle soft global IT demand and smaller rivals focused on providing software over the Internet.

column4: New Zealand on cusp of America's Cup victory
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Emirates Team New Zealand on Wednesday edged to within one win of taking home the America's Cup  defeating Oracle Team USA in a close-fought race that again showcased the Kiwis' seamless teamwork and superior strategy at the start.

column4: Oracle's new software sales rise 4 percent in first quarter
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Sept 18 Oracle Corp on Wednesday reported a 4 percent increase in new software sales and Internet-based software subscriptions to $1.7 billion in its fiscal first quarter  in line with its own forecasts.

column4: Sailing-New Zealand gets fresh shot to wrest America's Cup from Oracle
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Sept 18 Emirates Team New Zealand gets a fresh opportunity to capture the America's Cup from Oracle Team USA on Wednesday after high winds scuppered the previous day's racing.

column4: Internet radio service Pandora prevails in license dispute
column5: Pandora Media Inc has won a Manhattan federal court decision rejecting efforts by some music publishers to narrow a license that enables the largest U.S. Internet radio service to play their music.

column4: Internet radio service Pandora prevails in license dispute
column5: Sept 17 Pandora Media Inc has won a Manhattan federal court decision rejecting efforts by some music publishers to narrow a license that enables the largest U.S. Internet radio service to play their music.

column4: Brazil's Petrobras CEO says no sign U.S. NSA hacked oil bid data
column5: BRASILIA  Sept 18 The head of Brazil's state-run company Petrobras said on Wednesday there was no evidence its computers had been hacked by a U.S. intelligence agency to give American companies the edge in bidding for a large off-shore oil field next month.

column4: UPDATE 2-Siemens names new CFO  makes more board changes
column5: * Ralf Thomas  CFO of Siemens' Industry business  named group CFO

column4: Schlumberger unit files patent suit against Norway's PGS
column5: OSLO  Sept 18 Schlumberger subsidiary WesternGeco has filed a patent infringement complaint against Oslo-listed seismic surveyor PGS in a Houston court  the Norwegian firm said in a statement late on Tuesday.

column4: Southern Copper plans to start work on delayed projects in 2014
column5: AREQUIPA  Sept 18 Global miner Southern Copper  expects to start work on two delayed copper projects in Peru next year and could see production from them as early as 2016  the company's chief executive said on Wednesday.

column4: Toyota to lift Argentina plant capacity to 140 000 units at end-2015
column5: TOKYO  Sept 19 Toyota Motor Corp said on Thursday it will lift the annual production capacity at its Zarate plant in Argentina to 140 000 vehicles from 92 000 at the end of 2015.

column4: UPDATE 2-Toyota to make RAV4s in Russia after $181 mln expansion
column5: * RAV4 popular in Russia  sales rose 43 pct yoy in Jan-Aug

column4: TransCanada doing planned maintenance on Keystone pipeline
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Sept 18 TransCanada Corp said on Wednesday it is carrying out planned maintenance on its 590 000-barrel-per-day Keystone oil pipeline and the work is not expected to have any impact on September shipments on the line.

column4: Verizon exec says tech firms 'grandstanding' over NSA -report
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 18 A senior executive for Verizon Communications Inc has accused U.S. technology companies of "grandstanding" in public comments about their forced cooperation with U.S. spy agencies  according to a report by technology news website ZDNet.com.

column4: Verizon exec says tech firms 'grandstanding' over NSA -report
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 18 A senior executive for Verizon Communications Inc has accused U.S. technology companies of "grandstanding" in public comments about their forced cooperation with U.S. spy agencies  according to a report by technology news website ZDNet.com.

column4: Wells Fargo cutting 1 800 jobs in mortgage business: report
column5: NEW YORK Wells Fargo & Co.   the biggest U.S. mortgage lender  is cutting 1 800 jobs in its home-loan production business  Bloomberg reported on Wednesday.
